segments.text: I'm watching the woman at the sink again.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: She's so focused on that plate she's drying.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It's almost as if she's in her own little world.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The water is just gushing over the sink's edge.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It's formed a significant puddle on the floor around her.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Her foot is literally in the water, yet she shows no reaction.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: How can someone be so completely oblivious to their surroundings?
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The children are behind her, plotting their cookie heist.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: She doesn't notice the tipping stool or the reaching hands.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It's truly astonishing how unaware she is of everything.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: This level of detachment is quite frustrating to witness.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I just want to shout at her to look down.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: She continues her task, completely serene.
segments.speaker: PAR
